reviews.review_msg: He is one of my favourite prof at SFU!
I like this teacher. Some teachers talk a lot in class, but you feel learn nothing. He is that kind of teacher who doesn't impress you at first, but soon you will find he is knowledgeable.

Actually he is a very nice teacher. If you take notes in class and do every exercise, you can get a very good grade in final. He is very patient and answer questions. Although he is not as funny as other teachers, you can actually learn something from his class.

He is a very nice professor.  His exams are very straight forward, though his notes are straight from the text book.  I didn't do good on the two midterms, but I ended up getting a decent grade.  Finals are relatively easy compare to other SFU econ prof.
Horrible Prof, Material is straight out of the textbook.  Too much material too, for the course! Horrible grade.

His lectures are boring, he doesn't give breaks in a 2hr lecture, and it also seems like he is reading the lecture slides to himself rather than projecting it to the class. Midterms were relatively easy compared to the final, where questions were asked on materials where he ironically said during lecture that we wouldn't need to know for the final.

More than half of the students didn't show up during lecture time. His lectures were basically the summary of the textbook. Midterms were easy but final was quite tough. So aced the midterms if u can =D

Although his teaching is quite boring, but I think he is one of the easiest economic prof. in SFU.   Exams are fair, just read his lecture slides and you are ready to go.  I didn't even use the text book at all  :)

I don't understand why SFU hires a guy with language prblem to teach a university course. He has accent and his speeches are broken. And even worse, he reads off power point slides 99% of time in the lecture. I've had enough that SFU hire a TA to teach economics courses. Where are the professors and where does our tuition go????
couldn't ever hear what she said in the lecture, so students including myself lost interest
Avoid her if you have other chances. BAD BAD prof ever!!!
Worst class taken at SFU. Not happy with the prof, very negative.

The only problem with this prof is that most of the time she is very hard to hear because she have a partial Russian accent and she mumbles and she does not know how to use the mic properly. On exams she is average not hard nor easy. People complain because they don't pay attention and play with their laptops. But she is helpful if you ask her Q's.
bad bad prof, so mean by the way
She always ask questions out of the textbook, i have no clue her  2 midterms, even final is hard. Her sense of humor Avoid her, otherwise you will get stuck in this course.
really dont konw what she's talking about
Sh's pretty knowlegable. has a deep understanding of the concepts
esay one, funny guy
Easy course

First off, Akbar's accent is not hard to understand. Second, he is the sure way to go, especially for tough courses like 305. Akbar is probably the most knowledgeable prof in econ and he hammers the concepts into your brain to the point that they become impossible to forget. His midterms are not hard but final is harder. Assignments are a breeze!
The worst I have seen in the department. No knowledge, and quite evil attitude. Jokes sound quite insulting. May give low average to class, for example, C.

I dont think he's as difficult as others mention! 2 mt 2 assnms and final. no MC questions. MTs are fair but final was hard.he's accent but you get used to it by time. you've to study both class notes and text.he's good sense of humor. even though i expected higher grade at the end, i'm satisfied his teaching and i'd take more classes with him.

I came into this class with preformed prejudices towards Akbar, but rudeness and intimidation, hes a great lecturer! his notes are great for studying, the assignment qs are essential to passing! he is sometimes hard to understand bc of his accent, but you get by. hilarious when he cracks a joke! talk in class is good. mt and final was fair-hard.
The best Prof in Econ department!! I took both Econ 103 and 210 with him, he is a very nice person! I love his lecture!!  ^^
good funny teacher.....great course great teacher....recommend!!

This guy is awesome. he is SOOOOO funny, like omg. his exams are very easy and fair. there are no surprises, so as long as you know what is going on in the class, then you will do fine in his class. i dont know why this guy has such a bad rating, he is a REALLY good teacher. he explains concepts very clearly. All in all, a very dedicated professor

Funny ass teacher, going to his class is like a fob russell peters comedy show. This teacher is a G for sure, got over 90% on both midterms and just wrote my final. the 1 class that i enjoyed in sfu this semester.

Worst prof/class I've had. Doesn't seem to understand material, gives unclear/incorrect explanations, contradicts the textbook, lectures were a waste of time. Exam questions seemed straightforward, but marking scheme was very strange and subjective. Worst marks I have ever gotten in my life, but somehow ended up with A+ overall after the final.
hard to understanding his talking... he is just reading the notes during the lecture!!!

I have to say..this is a WAAAAAAAY underrated prof! Sure he picks out students during class and asks them questions... but he explains all his concepts 'very' clearly and is pretty funny too. You can't get another prof who gives exams EXACTLY on the assignments and the things that he talked about repeatedly in class.

worst prof EVER. mt were "short-answer" questions which he expects us to have "explanations". my TA said he docked marks NOT b/c of content but b/c of the amount written. TA kept teaching the wrong things in class. akbar has thick accent, but bearable if you pay attention. wastes a lot of time asking questions and get people to be involved in class
at first his accent is a little hard to understand but his exams is so fair cuz it's everything he talks about in class. there is no tricks in his exams, they are straight forward. gpa booster
GPA killer. don't take his course. he never reply your email if he does not like to
Question on exams are not in line with his answer key, therefore you must answer a part of the question that isn't even there, to get full marks

i like him. his humor is somewhat crass-i think that's why ppl think he's actually mean, but i find him hilarious. content is a bore but what do u expect? class is easy, everything is from the textbook/lecture notes. how to ace his course? figure out his marking style and adapt to it!!
WORST PROF IN SFU HISTORY, STOP TAKING COURSES WITH HIM SO OTHER STUDENTS DON'T HAVE TO SUFFER LIKE WE DID.

This guy is a hard marker, his lectures are terrible. can't understand this guy. i suppose if i were from india it would be alright, but i don't speak punjabi. nice guy to talk to though and makes an attempt at helping you out but a hard marker, often missing things that you should have gotten marks for.

Many may disagree, but I think he's unfair and unprofessional.First off, people mite find him easy b/c everything is based on the textbook, but do you consider someone who just stands there and read off powerpointslides good at teaching?thats not teaching, thats reading, anybody can do that!@the end of the sem, he claims "too many people are gettin

Breath of fresh air. This guy is an awesome prof. He is funny and wants all of his students to do well. Exams, Assignments and Lectures are all connected there are no surprises. Attend lectures b/c everything he stresses is on the exam . The course content is very interesting. Accent adds to the humour, wish there were more profs like him.
Pretty funny guy.  Somewhat easy, the quizzes and assignments keep you on track and are easy to get 100% on!

Very strong east-Indian accent (understandable). He wants everyone to do well. Be prepared for questions in lecture. Its not hard to do well in his class. STOP COMPLAINING ABOUT THE ACCENT AND MAN UP!

omg avoid this prof if possible. could not understand his accent and all he does is read off his slides. and he repeats the same stuff right b4 the midterm.. exact same stuff. would not recommend him.

Prof. Martin is a pretty good economics professor. In order to do well in his class you must write the notes for yourself and not just read the notes that he provides. The midterms and finals are very straight forward and come straight out of the notes. He is not as bad as everyone says!
He doesn't go over any of the complicated math in class and just flys through his lecture notes. Absolutely boring and pointless material was being "taught". He really needs to get a haircut.

The greatest professor ever. Every aspects of him is good. Well prepare notes, super fair exams, great teaching ability, and best of all, its his looks. He looks like the villian from the movie "bad boys2" hot!!

This is the Worse teacher I have ever had! I just finished my exam today and I screwed so bad! The only thing he mentioned about the final is " it is cumulative; it can be anything throught out the semester." how are students supposed to prepare for it then? It's not like we only TAKE one course which is econ 210 lol! Bad Bad accent! Suckx!!!

Seriously, if you guys think this course will be a GPA booster, i think you guys better think one more time, ohhh i forgot, this course maybe a GPA booster BUT if you take with F. Martin, your GPA is not gonna boost up but climbing down...seriously avoid this guy if you have a choice...
BORING LECTURES!!! Not a hard class. His lectures tell you what's on the exam. Use the powerpoint slides from his notes as a guide and study from the text. You'll just fall asleep in lectures anyway.
No Comments
easy class... boring lectures.. but I got an A (just make sure you do the readings and excercises from the text).
Exams were fair, just have to know your stuff. If you study it's definitly possible to get a good mark. Lectures give you a good idea of what will be on exams, although they're very boring.
No Comments
Worst teacher I have ever seen since I was 4! He destroyed my passion for economy!!!! I hope SFu fire him as soon as possible
Not only is the book a better teacher, it also has a better personality. BAD BAD BAD BAD BAD BAD^9999999 x 10^125000 x 4 = him
No Comments

this was the worst class I've ever taken and I've been to 2 other universities...he just read of the textbook powerpoints in class and the exams were very hard and the averages in the 50%'s.  If you have to take this class try to get a different teacher

he is the most boring prof ever! The entire course marks are only the 2 midterms & Final. He does not go over even the equation or do any examples with us. The TA are also no help at all. Eventhough u really wanted to listen in class, u will find yourself doing other things or just staring & not taking anything in.

Well where to start? First off he has an accent so its very hard to understand him. He just reads off the powerpoint and again its hard to understand him so pretty much everyone (even the most interested) fall asleep. But if anything poked fun at himself saying that "once Im done this slide you all can fall asleep". Also avg. exam mark was low!!!
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
I like his notes.......so we don't need to study the whole text book
bored lecure...ZzzZzzz
No Comments
vague range of midterm and final exam, extremely little office hour
Ideas are straight forwards but not clear on what he is looking for on exams.
No Comments
very cold and impersonal
No Comments

If you have some extra cash laying around and you dont want to learn anything, then take his class. Basically a waste of tuition fees. Class is a joke, marking system is a joke, prof is a joke. Its like a comedy act but the joke is on you at the end. I was one of the students that did well on the midterms, participated fully and ended up with a B.
Great, learned alot:)

Good Prof, knows his stuff, and is willing to help if u dont understand...the best econ prof i hav had at sfu and kwantlen!!Def shud attend class cuz it makes a huge difference, also really funny and tlks about ligit stuff that u need to move on
worst instructor in sfu!!!!
took 210 in Fall 2002. Very hard material, but did not get a lot of helps. ended up with B but know nothing..
worst instructor I have ever seen,no way to prepare final and midterm is all about memorize stuff,not fair at all.class is fun but useless.
Awsome!!!!!...I would recomend him..uses many real life examples. Learned about finance and investments...a real treat to have..thankss sukii=)

Good prof able to keep students interested in every class with subtle jokes/ off-topic comments! Course material is easy just follow notes. Only thing is he NEVER ANSWERS emails or have a course website so things can be confusing as to when are assignments due etc. Want to compliment the TA: BO CHEN, GREAT EXPLANATIONS AND GREAT INTEREST IN ECON!

Suki is the best prof so far at my 3rd yr SFU. mid-term and finals are straight forward from notes. no tricky questions if you referred from notes. tutorials questions are helpful but mainly focus on notes you will be receiving an B or above.. thank you Suki
someone who related books to business.  tells you what he will ask on exams.

Easy course if you listen to Suki...he told us exactly what would be on the tests (questions from the back of the book, and lecture notes for the final).  And bonus marks for telling a joke on the exams.  Good prof if you listen and attend lectures.
midterm was same as the questions in the back of the  book and final was completely on the lecture notes. He's very unorganized so its sometimes hard to tell what points belong under which categories

Totally hopeless. The endless overhead transparency notes are useless with the lectures unclear and devoid of structure. Exams should not be taken from questions at the back of the textbook. That is a clear shirking of his duties as a professor. Doesn't answer emails and is never induring office hours.
Read the Prof, watch for the dropping of subtle hints, an anyone will get at least a B- without any effort. I mean none.

Pretty good teacher, although sometimes a little confusing, as he jumps from lecturing to something off-topic.  Funny guy, and his exams are not _too_ difficult... he even tells you where he will be getting the questions from.
if u really like copying tons of poor notes and awful jokes, take it

I agree with some of the other posts, his writing is awful.  He doesn't explain things. He doesn't understand his own concepts during lectures as he often says see me after class, but he takes off early.  You have to go to class as the Textbook is useless.  I learned nothing from his class and got a B+. SFU, hire a better qualified professor.
his midterm for this semester is just every single questions from the answer key on the back of the book.basically his notes is the most important study resources.
lecture notes are important.

Never trust what he said for the finals.He told the class (for final exam)that he'll have calculations and most of the materials are tested after the midterm.Its turns out to be no calculations and most of the materials are from the materials before the midterm.I admit he's a nice and funny teacher but most likely u don't need to go to his class.
covers chapter a week plus. writing could improve.  talks about real life a-lot.  seems like he is good at lecturing
No Comments

One of the worst Econ professor I have ever encountered in my life. Bad attitude with impossible exam.  Maybe time for ECON department to fire instructors that either can't teach or speak proper English.  Let's face it, SFU will never be as good as UBC with the quality of our instructors.

The only thing u need to do in his classes is trying to copy down all those slides. The only thing u need to do for his exam is getting the previous exams. I got straight As in all econ courses except a C in his 210.
Not even joking, worst professor in my whole academic career!!  Plz anyone thinking of taking his classes, steer clear of it.  You'll be glad u did!!
VERY BADH: Lives up to his name.

He is horrible at teaching. Since he was my prof and TA, I was royally ****** and ended up with a lower mark compared to my other economics courses. Don't take his class if you don't have to. His notes were unclear and disorganized, and he waste a lot of time cracking lame jokes...
Incompetent. Doesn't know what he's talking about. Very lame jokes. Notes that are outdated and doesn't correlate with text. Doesn't care about students or teaching but his own business. Enough said.

the book was horrible, his teaching was horrible, and he was very unfair. if he didnt like you in tutorial he would always pick on you. he is also very disorganized and loses assignments and midterms.  do not take his class, take it with some other prof.
what I learned is just some equations, nothing else. u can study the textbook by urself.
No Comments

Very decent prof.  He's a pretty funny guy and he is good at communicating the course material.  He does tend to give false information regarding the contents of his exam (maybe to penalize those who don't read the material).  But overall, the exam isn't too hard.  Very decent prof.
There is quite a bit of material to cover, but lecture notes really help! Written questions on tests are mostly from lecture stuff... Pretty nice prof...
super boring textbook.. always thinks his jokes are funny~ his midterms and exams are on average ok... but kinda horrible writing~~

he is the worse prof in SFU ever, can't teach, can't even keep his words. he tricks students in the WRONG way, tells stupid jokes all the time. if i were the chair of econ department, i would fire him without second thought
Complicated textbk, crappy notes...irresposible prof~~
Dont Keep His words...low credibility~~
A hard course and a bad professor do not mix together.
No Comments
I got an A for the midterm, but I believe I failed the final for this course. Very unclear, teaches too fast. Notes are crap. The book being used is by far the worst I have encountered in my life.
No Comments

This guy is irresponsible and unorganized..skipped the last class on Thursday.. come on, no review? skipped the final exam as well? ask your girl or wife did the job for you? wake up, man.. WE PAID THE TUITION!
Suki, you rock!

he doesn't keep his words at all!! he promised 40% calculation on final, but in reality we didn't a single calculation at all!!! he's been giving out false information throughout the whole semester. and his exams r unreasonable!!
know notes, text and do homework and you'll do fine
Worst prof. useless textbook...!
No Comments
Agree with the reviews below me. "Sucky Bad" is probably his real name.
Lame jokes, looks and acts like a slick used car salesman.  Decent prof for the 15 mins he spends on material each lecture.  A little eye candy, you can tell he's no stranger to the gym.
his notes is useless

He can't teach!! Tries too hard to be funny, every single class! Just teach man!! He thinks he is soo slick. Suki tends to mumble at the end of his speech, which makes it extra hard to hear him clearly!! His tests are super hard!!!
Stop cracking jokes and get down to work.
This guy needs to stop cracking jokes and get down to work! He says that Peter Kennedy (SFU Econ Prof) is his role model, but Peter is waaaaay better!
He is very lazy. The questions are not hard but u can write a 12 pages essay on each question. Eg. Why do banks exist?
Fun prof. I think he did a good job presenting a lot of material in a relatively short amount of time. The final is really hard though.

Suki is a funny guy.  The lectures were for the most part interesting and he seemed enthusiastic teaching it. Good course if you want to learn about the bond market. However, final was a bit hard because we had to cover like 16 chapters.
Well, not bad, quite funny in the lecture....but he doesn't follow the book, the book itself is useless!
fun guy, hard course.  Alotta this stuff u gotta already know from econ 105/103.  He only presents you material, doesn't explain it very well....or im just dumb.
Everyone ends up dropping his class! Do not take unless needed.. if you take it, pay attention to detail! Quizzes and homework don't mean #$@&! Memorize notes and text.
No Comments
Suki was very clear durinf lectures and exams were fair.
He made class fun to attend, the course material was interesting and his test were reasonable.
Suki is a good prof
His final's questions were EXACTLY the same as the review questions, if you didn't read it, you pretty much threw an A away. His MCs on exams are predictable, and his lectures are far from boring.
Funny prof. Material before midterm is fine but after the midterm he teaches very fast. The homework is not useful at all.
the final exam is extremly UNfair. trust me or not u will find out by urself =] overall he is the worst i had in sfu

He talks in a clear voice, his writting are readable, and his quizzes and exams are quite easy. If you know how to apply the theories then you will be fine. Final's questions was EXACTLY the same as the review questions, so...enough said.
Talk too fast! Exams are hard!
I liked him... found his classes fun to go to. Know your textbook (all of it even dates) and for the final know your textbook and your macro theory

I found the class rather easy... know the textbook for the quizes... the final has some extra stuff on it... if you want an A it might even be worth going over your macro textbook, stuff like MCI will show up on the final even if it's not covered in class
Mean Prof.  Worst prof. I had so far.  Not a good choice if you want to learn or get easy credits.
Funny guy, very good at explaining the materials. He will often let his personal life seep into lectures. Class is bell curved, so know your stuff.
Econ 210 is a hard course. Suki notes is not very useful. Please read your textbook, then you will be fine. Fair mid-term, but hard final exam.
final exam is very hard... NOT FAIR!
A very good prof, probably one of the best at explaining the material that I ever had...
He is Ok.  His exams are pretty easy and straight forward
No Comments
No Comments
Lengthy course notes
cocky, very bad teacher
Exams are hard and can be tricky.  Know the text inside out.
great personality, talk too fast, volume sometimes high and low, hard exams
No Comments
Difficult and unfair short answer questions on the midterm
No Comments
No Comments
he's a nice teacher, yaar. better than most i've seen so far.
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
Boring , bad jokes
Suck~ Dont know what the hell he is talking about!
No Comments
No Comments
I LIKE HIM! =)
